title: [威士忌]Talisker 57 Degree North
content:
https://i.imgur.com/5d2EM8w.jpg
57% abv in special strength, non chill-filtered
.
Talisker is the only distillery on the Isle of Skye, which located at 57 degree north longitude. Bless with the special location, Talisker distillery was characterized with saltiness flavour. As well as Talisker’s unique shape small copper still, their newmake is extraordinary strong and powerful, with signature “pepper palating” at the end. 
This non-age statement whisky was a special series from Talisker, promote with the slogan “57% special strength.” They bottled this whisky in 57% abv, which corresponded to the geographic longitude of Skye island. According to Scotch Whisky Association, this adjustment of abv could not meet the standard of “cask strength”, so they introduce as “special strength. “ This bottle is limited released and is no longer available. What a pleasure I am to have the chance to appreciate this wonderful masterpiece.  
.
Color: amber to gold
Nosing: strong smoky, dry tropical fruits, spicy chili, after diluting with distill water, smoky aroma extended and chili softened to grind pepper and 
Palpating: medium bodied, absolutely fruitiness like dry mango, then strong chili kicks in and dominates all the taste buds, aggressive yet powerful impact, sweet as caramel at the end with more oily body
Aftertaste: long, chili sensation lingering a while, back-fired through out throat to upper palate, leaving saltiness and slightly iodine
.
